website_summaries.verdict: It's a reasonable option if you like the idea of a wall-mounted model and your cat isn't an extremely vigorous scratcher.
pros: A space-saving scratching post that attaches securely to a wall with adhesive-backed mounting hooks
cons: Our testers found that it shreds easily with frequent use, and it doesn't seem to attract cats as easily as other models we reviewed

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Unlike some 'cat furniture', this item is well-made and attractive, with sleek lines and plain white sides. It mounts via four adhesive-backed hooks that grab the corrugated surface, and which should make replacement easy when the scratcher inevitably wears out. More to the point, our cats love this thing. Well, at least our older guy does—he went right to work breaking it in, and has been having a go at it regularly. Our five month old kitten is still in her "wild explorer" phase, and seems more interested in using the scratcher in her efforts to scale the bedroom wall, rather than for its intended purpose. We'll be ordering another of these for the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua GTop Contributor: Ham Radio

customer_reviews.title: I really would never recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: My cat ripped his thing to pieces in 2 weeks!! I really would never recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Not very attractive but it works
customer_reviews.text: I tried putting this upright against the leather piano bench my cat was clawing, and she ignored it. Then it slipped down flat on the floor and now she uses it all the time and pretty much ignores the piano bench. My other cat doesn't use it, probably because the she-cat claimed it, but the he-cat has his own scratching post so that's okay. Try it in various positions before sticking it to anything.
customer_reviews.author: Marcia Purse

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My cat very quickly picked up how to use this post and hasn't scratched on anything else since. A lot of people have said that the hooks that come with it don't work but I haven't had any problems with them. They were easy to attach to the wall and are holding the post very securely. I tried to wiggle the post to see how the hooks were working and I couldn't move the post at all so I doubt my cat would be able to. I like this post design because it allows my cat to stretch out his arms like he normally does when scratching -- it's a very natural scratching design.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Cats Love It!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for my fur people. I have a lot of different personalities with scratch type preferences. Within a minute of installing it, they were all vying to use it. No catnip needed. Very easy to put up. You can place it at any height you wish. Quite durable. I have one cat that seems to enjoy trying to pull it off the wall and hasn't been successful in his quest. The only thing I wish is that they just had replacement scratchers since it would be easy to take it off and put a new one on. Though I've put a new scratcher on it, they really enjoy that lip on the bottom for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Not for every cat
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this product, but not as good in execution. The hooks are great, very sturdy! My cat likes the cardboard for scratching. The issue I ran into was the cat would scratch the same place all the time, it wore down quickly, and I couldn’t move the position of the scratcher because of the curved bit at the bottom. So I had to replace it very quickly! I did end up putting it in my windowsill, and now my cat lays on it, which he loves, just not how it was meant to be used. Might not work for every cat as desired.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Rentz

customer_reviews.title: works great just not on the wall LOL
customer_reviews.text: Cat loves it just not on the wall LOL I took it down after 3 weeks becuase shen would not scratch on it I layed it in the floor and she was all over it loved it like that LOL I bought it becuase she was scratching up the walls LOL ... she don't scratch on the walls now only this thing so I guess it worked after all just next time I'll save money and get one that just lays in the floor ... update it's holding up very well have not even had to turn it over and use the other side yet well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: but if your cats LOVE cardboard scratchers (like mine)
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a vertical cardboard scratcher that does not move? This is literally the ONLY one on the market. For all people making reviews saying this item is too expensive I agree, but if your cats LOVE cardboard scratchers (like mine), but also love to scratch vertically and are destroying your furniture (like mine) THIS IS THE BEST OPTION! Please 4CLAWS considering lowering the price. I mean it is at least three times the price of a cardboard scratcher you can buy at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: My cats loved this, perhaps a bit too much
customer_reviews.text: My cats loved this, perhaps a bit too much. It was destroyed in two days and I was finding bits of cardboard all over the house. We have had other cardboard scratchers that held up better, but this is was flimsy and easily shredded. It was not worth the mess to give my cats a couple of days of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this! Some of the scratching posts that they ...
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this! Some of the scratching posts that they have are not as sturdy, so they dislike using them. They also like that they can stretch up and scratch rather than bending down and doing it. The top is absolutely shredded and it's only been a month! The only thing I would suggest if you buy this is to figure out where the little sticker hook things go before you put them on the wall/in the post, especially if you have molding along your wall.
customer_reviews.author: H.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It stuck right to the wall with adhesive only and has not budged since, which is surprising because I have two cats who go AT it when they scratch on this thing. They really enjoy being able to stretch upwards and it's hard to find a quality cardboard scratcher that's tall enough. With 2 cats scratching it daily, it's already starting to wear out. It would be perfect if it was wider, even double the current width. It's a little narrow, but it does the job. If I can't find a better option, I'll be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay ParkhurstTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It was smaller then I imagined I have 3 cats ...
customer_reviews.text: It was smaller then I imagined I have 3 cats and they used it and it broke off and now they use it on the ground but it slides all over the wood floors. I thought it would sleek and not a eye sore but it's so discreet that the cats overlook it too. I have bought products from this company before and it came with cat nip but it did not this time .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well in a Multi Cat Household
customer_reviews.text: This Scratching post is ideal to put on the corner of a room divider. All of our cats have their claws and they have been unable to pull it off the wall. This is the second time we have bought one of these. They last about a full year in a multi cat household. It does leave pieces of cardboard on the floor but an easy clean up. Much better than ruining our furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Alice B.

customer_reviews.title: Good for tall cats
customer_reviews.text: We recently got new living room furniture because the cats destroyed the old stuff with their clawing ritual. We got this and they haven't touched the new furniture, so we're very happy. We have a Maine Coon and the problem with other scratching posts is that they are too short for him. This can be hung at whatever height you want so it solved a problem for us.
customer_reviews.author: knitty pants

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool and my cat seems to agree!
customer_reviews.text: Mounted using included hardware about 6 inches off the floor so my Siamese could fully stretch while scratching. After a few days of mild interest and some uncertainty he now regularly uses this for fulfilling his natural desire/need to scratch. Only downside is he now walks by two other much more expensive options to use this one. I would estimate this will last several months based on very little damage after two weeks of using it. But full disclosure he is barely 10lbs and pretty gentle. I highly recommend- both aesthetics and cat acceptance/use are excellent. Would buy a wider version also - so if you make other versions please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: which after a while started to leave the wall dirty. I got this in the hopes of protecting ...
customer_reviews.text: My declawed cat kept "scratching" on the wall near her food, which after a while started to leave the wall dirty. I got this in the hopes of protecting my paint while still allowing her to "scratch". At first she wasn't sure, but I just put a tiny bit of catnip on it and she now uses it like she did before but more now. It mounted easily to the wall and has stayed put. I'm not sure how it would be with a cat that actually has claws, since they would sink them int the post itself and pull down. I'm going to order a couple more for other spots around the house.
customer_reviews.author: JABHBDBM

customer_reviews.title: Cat is not a fan!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves cardboard scratchers. Unless they are on the wall or door. He likes them on the floor. He won’t use vertical scratching anything ... I put this on the back of my front door where he claws to get out (he’s indoor and planning his escape intently), and now he claws next to it. 🤷🏼‍♀️ I’ll probably take it off of the door and put it on the floor with the other two I have. He’s already shredded one in under a month.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised but highly overpriced. My cat actually scratches on it more when it is laid down so this was a waste for me as I can get a similar product for much cheaper. The curved edge was useless. You could probably just use leftover command strips to mount it too instead of spending your money on this
customer_reviews.author: Sue Jiang

customer_reviews.title: Waaaay over priced for what it is: cardboard like all the rest.
customer_reviews.text: It's rare to feel as swindled as I did by buying this cardboard thing for my cats. I don't know why I thought the price would indicate some higher level of quality. It does not. Don't waste your money. This thing should not cost a dime over 14.99. I'll probably return it just to retain some inkling of sanity.
customer_reviews.author: Woodrow

customer_reviews.title: No need for the wall
customer_reviews.text: We love this for our cat, we didn’t use for the wall because the brackets were flimsy. But while trying to figure a way to get it on the wall she used it while it was on the floor and she loves it!!! Place it so it’s angled up, not flat-she looks like she’s climbing up a hill and she shreds the crap out of it😊
customer_reviews.author: Robin jacquot

customer_reviews.title: Cat starting to catch on
customer_reviews.text: Our cat was destroying a corner beam/post at the top of our stairs. He goes over there and scratches every time he wants to get our attention. Now we have tricked him into scratching on this cardboard thing and he seems to be falling for it. I was surprised that the little sticky hook things would hold this to the wall, but it does hold up and seems to adhere very well to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: lisa marie

customer_reviews.title: THey love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: My boys love this!!! They already have another scratcher that lays flat on the floor but they love this one. They also have a cat tree, but something about this upright scratcher that they love! I have to order more as they've almost scratched through it I would recommend hanging it higher than the directions state. Hanging to the stretched out length of your cat as they will stretch up to it to scratch it
customer_reviews.author: Terra

customer_reviews.title: The best scratcher my cat has ever enjoyed
customer_reviews.text: My cat craves furniture. I live in the tropics so everything I own is wicker or rattan. I’ve tried Sticky Paws, spray deterant and cellophane wraps to keep him from destroying the furniture. He’s an indoor/outdoor guy so I can’t trim his claws. You’d think he would have enough natural scratching posts outside on an acre of land. But he has his indoor home and this scratcher is his best friend. I even bought more to place around the house. The scratchers blend in nicely with the decor. You can place them anywhere and they look fine. He can’t get enough of these and he’s an extremely finicky cat.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but makes a mess
customer_reviews.text: My cat used this scratching post, which is great, but the more he schratched the more shreds he left on the floor. I suppose that's the norm with this type of material, but I haven't owned this type before and didn't anticipate it. We eventually took it down because it looked shabby and was a shredded mess.
customer_reviews.author: cmr0996

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loved It!
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a wall near our living room couch to deter our cat from scratching the couch. She was immediately drawn to it and it has lasted so long - despite daily scratches! I like the simple pattern so it blends into the environment and stands out less!
customer_reviews.author: Maris S.

customer_reviews.title: Well used, daily
customer_reviews.text: We have bought several of these scratchers and love them. Both cats use them several times a day. We have trained them to use the one in the kitchen for treats and it has reduced the amount of furniture scratching immensely. There are little cardboard bits strewn about constantly but I won’t complain about that. We have had a few incidents where the support hooks have bent and the scratcher has come off the wall but that doesn’t diminish our fondness for them- for the amount of use they get and the way they have saved our furniture they deserve five stars!
customer_reviews.author: mainerjane

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing. I have tried so many scratching post that ...
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. I have tried so many scratching post that I lost count. Some are standing as "furniture" (he's not interested), some he won't touch, some that move immediately if he used them. This is pretty sturdy (and because of the architecture around my apartment) and its not even flushed to the ground. My cat is happy! He can stand and stretch and scratch what more would a cat want?
customer_reviews.author: Anahad09

customer_reviews.title: overpriced and doesnt last long (2 weeks)
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, easy to stick to the wall (it pulled my paint of when i took off the sticker :s) but the cardboard density/quality isn good so it doesnt last compared to our other cardboard scratchers. the cats loved it and could stretch as the scratched. i wish it lasted longer than 2 weeks especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: If you have a big cat probably get two and hang them side-by-side
customer_reviews.text: These are great, one of my girls was tearing apart the arm of my couch so I put two of these on the wall near that arm and she's completely leaving the couch alone. My cats are all large ragdolls and the item is definitely tall enough but I'm glad I got two to put them side by side because they're kind of narrow. For the average cat they're probably perfect. I have also found that the cardboard is good but its been a week and the girls have absolutely torn through it. All things considered, I will definitely be a repeat buyer, this is by far their favorite cardboard scratchers.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Kitty knows whats up!
customer_reviews.text: My cat scratched the walls. This make the cat not scratch the walls. HIGHLY recommend this. The hooks used to keep it up to the wall could use a more "command strip" sticky to it as the one it comes with leaves sticky crap on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Easily knocked off the wall, but works well.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this for the few months it worked, but it is so easily knocked off the wall... after the 20th or so time being knocked down it no longer stuck to the wall. It's not going to waste though.. they like to lay on it now. 4/5 cats loved it and used it more than any other scratching post. The other avoided that wall and found another... of course.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Calderhead

customer_reviews.title: Cats adore this
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Had to order another because after a coupleof years the old one was falling apart from constant use which is a good thing. My cats live this and one is definitely a vertical surface scratcher. Super easy to put up. Buy some spray catnip and your cats will love you. Just put it up today and the cats love it. I bought some spray catnip so that made it more appealing too. I'll comment again once I see how durable it is.
customer_reviews.author: Kitnkpr

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess and peels off dry wall
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loved this thing, but as she ripped it to shreds over time, I had to vacuum up the pieces of cardboard that covered the floor every few days. Worst of all, the adhesive that holds the mounts to the wall not only removed the paint, but actually removed the surface of the dry wall when I peeled them off. I tried peeling each of the 4 more slowly than the last and even tried to slip a razor blade in, but all 4 mounts ripped a chuck off the dry wall. Would not recommend this product to anyone unless you were mounting it on bare concrete or plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Yale

customer_reviews.title: Grateful for this!
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity of the design -- cardboard is such an honest material. The cats go to TOWN on this thing. From the moment it went up they knew exactly what to do. It was quick & clever installation (adhesive pads secure hooks to your surface, then the cardboard slides down onto the hooks) and I think it will last a long time. Everytime I hear the cats scratching at it I enjoy a moment of gratitude that they are not scratching my furniture.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great scratcher!
customer_reviews.text: We are very please with this scratcher. Our furry friend never used the scratchers I previously bought. He likes the vertical element (hence our damaged couch). Anyway, he's loving the scratcher and away from the couch.
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Apartment deposit saver!
customer_reviews.text: My cat was scratching the door frame constantly and nothing worked to stop her. Living in an apartment all i could do was see my deposit going down the drain. I bought this and hung it next to the door...and she LOVES it! No more problems with door frame scratching :) my cat uses it constantly and it lasted 4 months so id say its well worth it :)
customer_reviews.author: KMalTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: My lil' man, Sebastian, loves scratching vertically as most cats do. He took to this straight away. My only suggestion to other buyers is to stick 1 of the 4 provided hooks on the floor to ensure it doesn't move; and my only suggestion to the manufacturer, 4CLAWS is to make the scratching post just a tad longer so our furry felines can get a really good stretch when scratching!
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Check the item's dimensions! I made this mistake. ...
customer_reviews.text: Check the item's dimensions! I made this mistake... Just by eyeballing it I'd say t's about 4 inches wide by about 24 inches high. Never woould have purchased had I checked the size. Rookie mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Adventurist

customer_reviews.title: Picky kitty, great product
customer_reviews.text: My cat is super picky and she has torn this thing to shreds(in a great way). It is super messy but it's worth it because she doesn't scratch at our door frames like she had become accustomed to doing in our old house. I love that it doesn't take up much room and it hangs on the wall at a height that I can pick for her. She likes to stretch all the way out to scratch so other scratchers tend to be too short and she won't use them. It's a great product and I will buy it again when she wears this one out.
customer_reviews.author: carlton c.

customer_reviews.title: This is only the second bad review that I have ever written
customer_reviews.text: This is only the second bad review that I have ever written. This is overpriced, and didn't adhere to the wall at all. It is on it's way back to the seller. Probably cost about $2.00 to manufacture, counting the hooks. Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Carol4178

customer_reviews.title: For some reason my cat doesn't exactly understand what this ...
customer_reviews.text: For some reason my cat doesn't exactly understand what this is. We're thinking about putting it on the floor as right now she seems to be fond of plucking at our rug. The hooks are okay, seem a little bit fragile. It's a bit hard to get the positioning of the hooks and post right together so that the post is fully on the floor, but maybe that's just me. I'll update this review when we put it on the floor and see how my cat likes it.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny B

customer_reviews.title: Both cats love it
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats love this thing. It saves them from scratching couches in doorway openings. They both like to go vertical and almost stand when they sharpen their claws and this works great. It seems like they even prefer it to scratching at wood or cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony DiVeronica

customer_reviews.title: Necessity for cat owners
customer_reviews.text: This was my second time purchasing one of these for my cat. I’ve bought other scratchers that lay on the floor but he doesn’t mess with them. This vertical scratcher is the way to go. He loves it. It lasts quite awhile before you need to replace it. Easy to mount on the wall too.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a scratching post that my cat uses!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the very few scratching posts (other than my sofa :) ) that my cat actually uses! She uses the bottom part the most, but also enjoys the wall part so she can really stretch. Thanks for making a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The cats really like it, but it feels like I'm paying a ...
customer_reviews.text: The cats really like it, but it feels like I'm paying a lot for cardboard. I thought maybe the sides would be made of something more durable, but they are just white cardboard. I've had it for like a week and the scratching surface shows signs of wear. Again, this is good because it is being used, but also bad because I'm not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanna Fees

customer_reviews.title: Patience
customer_reviews.text: Kitty loves it while it is flat on the floor while still scratching the bathroom wall. But, tonight, I put it back on the wall and she seems to be getting the idea....slowly. She's an old lady, stuck in her old ways, but I have faith and patience. Next step is getting her to use her kitty water fountain. My bird loves it, so because the two of them are so jealous of each other, I have no doubt that the cat will get in on the action too.😀
customer_reviews.author: LENorway52

customer_reviews.title: Great solution
customer_reviews.text: Awesome scratching post that my cats took to immediately. I got this because one of my cats (white) recently started scratching at the carpet in the hallway. I don't have room to put in a cat tower right there so I started looking for an alternative. I put some cat nip on it and a toy on top to catch the interest of the carpet scratcher. They love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is SO much smaller than I thought, maybe ...
customer_reviews.text: It is SO much smaller than I thought, maybe a kitten could use this. The cat in the picture isn't stretched out fully so when my cats stretch they overshoot the post entirely. It was partially smashed in on the side when I got it from the shipper. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Send-It

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy - cat very happy
customer_reviews.text: One of my cats loves this scratcher. I got it for my sewing room since floor space is at a premium. Takes up a little space by the door and she loves it. Nice and sturdy - the wall hooks secure it better than I thought I would. My other cat completely ignores it (but so far he has disdained every other scratcher and only wants to use the carpet).
customer_reviews.author: Sherwood Knits

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but cat doesn’t use it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great scratching post from a design perspective. It’s much better looking than the usually sisal or carpet wrapped post and adheres to the wall well with the provided hooks. The downside is my cat doesn’t go near it. Even when I loaded it up with catnip she wasn’t interested. It’s only been here a week or so, and maybe she’ll decide it’s for her. Or maybe not — she is a cat, after all.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn McCormack

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Loves This
customer_reviews.text: My Maine Coon loves this! She would never use any style I brought home, so tried this one. (because I wanted a new couch!) I put some cat nip on it at first and placed her big paws on it. She took right to it, surprise! It wouldn't stay attached to the wall, so I took some twine and tied it to the end post of the railing to basement. It's been wonderful this past year. She wore it out, so I'm here buying another one.
customer_reviews.author: Deanne C.

customer_reviews.title: Good product , great for walls or anything vertical .
customer_reviews.text: I like this scratch post. Its very easy to install. Just measure the distance from the floor, so you have enough room when you slide it down on the hooks. It seems though the lower part doesn't get much use though.... i wonder how it will hold up once I flip it.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: The hooks stay on the wall pretty well, they do bent everytime the cat pulls ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 2 months and the cats distroyed it. Wish it would last longer for the price. The hooks stay on the wall pretty well, they do bent everytime the cat pulls it off the wall, which is once a week or so. I just bend the hooks back in shape and reattach the cardboard scratcher. Also, would be great if they made this reversable so that the cats can use both sides, and still be used for the wall. Anyways, it did save the molding from further distruction, so I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Jochum

customer_reviews.title: Great diversion for cats  from scratching the door weatherstripping!
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this just to the left the front door where my one cat had been scratching the weather stripping. (I like to keep my front door open with a screen door in place.) This scratching board did the trick to get my one cat diverted. I will give it an A+ for ease in mounting, an A for sturdiness, and a B- for durability. Two of my four cats regularly use this to sharpen their nails. They love it. This is a good value!
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Nice scratching board.
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this scratching board because of the cardboard material. Turns out though that she isn't a vertical scratcher so I had to take it down. The mounts that come with it are surprisingly strong and very cute! They're cat shaped! Even though no one will see it after it's mounted it is still a cute detail. Also, I tried to take off the mounts off my wall and it is so strong it peeled the paint off. So just a heads up!
customer_reviews.author: BountyrollosTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install; the cat took to it immediately
customer_reviews.text: The cat likes it, so that's important. But who can predict what a cat will like? This cardboard scratching post was easy to install, and I love that because it's wall-mounted it sits out of the way and doesn't take up a lot of space. I think it looks pretty unobtrusive on the wall - your eye hardly notices it. But when it arrived, I was slightly disappointed. It looked a little chintzy. It is just cardboard; there's nothing fancy here. But I think this is a great product and I think I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea, but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea and shape of this product. However, it could be a little longer. Also, the fasteners that connect to the wall could be stronger. This item for its quality is often overpriced. I know prices fluctuate on Amazon, so I am glad I did not buy this when the price is over $30. I wouldn't pay more than $18 is I was to buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Kadie

customer_reviews.title: My cat now prefers this to the chairs!
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy this after my cat decided she preferred my dining chair over her new cat condo-post. I would give this scratching post 5 stars if it wasn't so easy for my cat to knock it off the hooks. Though I'll be honest and say she's only knocked it off once. Otherwise, we love it. You will have to pick up a few of the cardboard flakes after a bunch of scratches, but that is to be expected. I would purchase and recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: SCA

customer_reviews.title: The cats really like this scratching post
customer_reviews.text: The cats really like this scratching post. We have several different types and this one has become a favorite. They like to stretch up and use it. The wall fasteners keep it stable so they can really use it with gusto! mama r
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name: mama r.

customer_reviews.title: Cats use it
customer_reviews.text: I have wall scratching cats so giving them an approved wall scratching area is essential. They do, Im happy. It’s a bit expensive but so is repainting.
customer_reviews.author: Charissa Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Stylish Wall Cat Scratching Pad
customer_reviews.text: We bought this scratching post as it's one of the nicer looking ones and we find the sisal carpet ones a bit big and not fitting in with our home interior. This post although a bit smaller than imagined, easily fitted to the wall with the stickies and is very secure. Our cat started using it and really seems to enjoy it. Best of all its keeping him from scratching the furniture. It's a winner, we will be purchasing again once this one is worn out.
customer_reviews.author: MISS L B Sheppard

customer_reviews.title: Yes, this does work!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase. I was not sure she would take to using this, but I put treats on the top edge to get her to reach for them and to have her claws on it to see how it would feel to her. She took to it right away and she is two years old. So you can teach even an older cat. I would recommend this as my new couch is not being destroyed, it is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Attached easily to the wall and has been holding steady for ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat took a while to use it, but I moved it to a corner and now he uses it all the time. Attached easily to the wall and has been holding steady for several months now, taking a beating from my hefty brute of a cat daily. It does shed paper bits, but no more than the carpet bits that came off of the old ugly carpet-covered monstrosity I used to have. This fits nicely and demurely out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: Purrfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect to help protect our wall from our cat that likes to scratch everytime we exit the door. Only thing that could make this better is making different heights.
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Good: Cats prefer this to furniture
customer_reviews.text: Good: Cats prefer this to furniture. Looks as attractive in the house as one could expect a cat scratcher to be. Not good: See the pictures of it against the wall? These baseboards are ant-sized and this will not happen for you without spacing it away from the wall. Should have been designed with a larger curve. Part of the deal: Scratching cardboard creates cardboard bits. Fortunately Roomba is on the job.
customer_reviews.author: jenifer taylor

customer_reviews.title: I love this scratching post and so does my cat
customer_reviews.text: I love this scratching post and so does my cat. I think it helps to keep him away from scratching the couch. Its just hard to keep it attached to the wall. The four metal clips that come with it are not enough. I use heavy duty velcro. It works for the most part. When the post was used alot like mine, eventually it came off of the wall. So the only thing you can do to hide the damaged wall is buy another post with new velcro!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Too much
customer_reviews.text: Skinny, flimsy and made out of the same stuff as the ones that cost $8. Total waste of money. It comes with really nice sticky cat shaped hooks to keep it on the wall though. At least you can repurpose those for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Fat Daddy Fly Socks Soul

customer_reviews.title: Scratch the post, not the back of the chair!
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to install BUT I would have liked the instructions in the package and not have to go to the website. 1or 2 simple sentences and done. They are starting to get the idea, not as quickly as I thought they would but they're cats! Finicky.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Kate

customer_reviews.title: seems like good quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this scratcher works well overall, but my cat wouldn't even touch it. She had been scratching doorframes so I thought this vertical scratcher would help prevent that, but alas. Nothing against the product itself, seems like good quality, but as we all know cats are quite picky!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fine if not wall mounted
customer_reviews.text: Great except if you want to hang it on the wall, the wall mounts are just a could of hooks that pierce the cardboard, will work loose quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Natural Redhead

customer_reviews.title: The only caveat is the adhesive on the hooks is very strong - it can be difficult removing them from the wall - so I use 3M Comm
customer_reviews.text: This scratching post is a furniture lifesaver! My cats were notorious furniture scratchers but after I purchased one of these they began using it immediately and have left the furniture alone. As a result, I have bought several and placed them throughout the house. I can also vertically reposition the scratcher so it gets use on the entire surface. The only caveat is the adhesive on the hooks is very strong - it can be difficult removing them from the wall - so I use 3M Command strips on the back of the hooks for easy removal with no wall damage.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste C. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Kitty loves it, wallet doesn’t
customer_reviews.text: My cat seriously loves this thing. I just wish it wasn’t so expensive. I tried wall-mounting a cheap cardboard scratcher with command hooks but it just wasn’t holding up to my crack-head-kitty’s incessant scratching like this thing. I’m now a subscriber to replace it every 2 months even though it’s over-priced, it’s worth it since he doesn’t scratch the furniture
customer_reviews.author: rgambo904

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced and my cat won't use it
customer_reviews.text: My cat has always been good and only scratched what he is supposed to, until we moved into a new place with carpeted stairs. I hung this on the wall next to the stairs hoping to redirect him, but he will not touch it. It doesn't look good enough to keep on the wall when it's being neglected, so I took it off, and the adhesive hangers ripped the paint off my wall. I will just keep buying him cheap scratchers from the grocery store which he likes just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Berry M.

customer_reviews.title: Great scratching post.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to hang on a wall, but as soon as I got it unwrapped my cat stretched out and started using it, full length, on the floor. He loves to stick his head in the curved end and scratch. I bought a second one for the other end of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Ireland

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy on wall, but poor quality overall
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased at how solidly this post attached to the wall hooks and to the wall. The good aspects end there though. My cat is wholly uninterested in cardboard scratchers, so this doesn't do much. I feel like it was pricy for a try at finding a good scratcher, and it feels cheap for the cost. I also imagine the hooks will do some damage to my apartment walls when I remove them. If you know your cat likes cardboard scratchers, this might work, but it probably won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Works good with catnip spray but far too expensive to keep buying. Can't turn it around to use the other side so it is wasted. Will probably cut the curved bottom off so can use that side.
customer_reviews.author: Buba

customer_reviews.title: Good value, sturdy and cats love it
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this. It stays put against the wall too. I'm a little worried it will remove paint from the wall when I finally have to take it down but we'll cross that bridge when it comes. If you rent or are worried I'd recommend to use command strips to adhere the hooks to the wall. I kind of wish I had done that myself. Great product though.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome idea. Unfortunately
customer_reviews.text: Awesome idea. Unfortunately, George (my recent rescue cat) is afraid of it. He's much rather scratch on the bottom of my bed... when I'm sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Gramama

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but our late middle aged kitty is ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it, but our late middle aged kitty is just puzzled by it. I removed her dilapidated scratching [post and another small cardboard scratching pad, but she hasn't figured out the new one is hers, too. I'm sure all will be well in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M Morris

customer_reviews.title: Second Downgrade of my initial review...
customer_reviews.text: The cats enjoyed using it so much, they wore it completely down and out many days ago. (Now) Disgusted by how much I paid for this... The free scratcher I received when we brought the kitties home 3-4 months ago is still in better shape. :(
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Winston likes it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat immediately scratched and started biting this thing - good signs! It isn’t as sturdy as I (or he) hoped, but it’s discreet and he likes it so I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin P

customer_reviews.title: Great item but don’t recommend stickers
customer_reviews.text: Great item. Wouldn’t recommend using the stickers that come with it. They hold up well but when you want to remove them they ended up peeling the paint on my wall. Instead I just use a screw and metal ring drilled through the top-center of it to keep it in place (easier to fill a screw hole down the road instead of 4 peeled paint spots). Cats love it though and I ended up getting a second for a different room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price unless you know your cat already likes ir
customer_reviews.text: this product is 100% cardboard, I thought the white edges were plastic for some reason, I'm only giving this a 3 star because I think it is highly over priced. I personally think this item should be in the $15 dollar range. Also my cat is not at al interested, which I understand isn't the sellers fault. Just disappointed in the cost of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: Save your furniture
customer_reviews.text: Cats love this with some catnip juice on it ,they will not shread your furniture! It's neat looks ok on the wall .just one thing don't hang it to high .i did and I had to rehang it lower then my cats loved it!
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: I love that! So make sure you know where to ...
customer_reviews.text: First time purchasing a scratching post that actually got the cat to use!! Takes up little room since its placed on the wall. The sticky spikes are VERY sticky and do not move without pulling off the paint and some of the drywall. I love that! So make sure you know where to place it before letting it touch the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Harris

customer_reviews.title: Tall, sturdy, wish it was flat so I could flip to back when front is used
customer_reviews.text: My cat is long, so I wanted a tall scratching post. This is tall and sturdy, easily attached to the wall. My cat started using it right away. I was worried he would destroy it in a week, but it seems to be lasting. My complaint is the lip at the bottom. It's a good idea - longer scratching surface - but when he uses all of the front, I want to be able to flip it over and use the back. Instead, I'll have to use the back as a scratching board on the floor. He likes to stretch and scratch upwards, so I only wish this could be a front and back vertical scratcher, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. One thing I will have to mention ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. One thing I will have to mention is my cat wouldn't go near it for about a week. Then we bought some catnip spray and our cap went APE! She loved it, we sprayed it for a couple of days and now she uses it all the time with no spray. We will probably get another one for upstairs. And it seems to hold up really good.
customer_reviews.author: Bmoser30

customer_reviews.title: Saved my sanity!
customer_reviews.text: My boy jack REFUSED to use any scratcher I got, so I went out on a limb and bought this. This is the first and only scratched he will use. It’s helped save my carpet and I’ve put one up in all his favorite scratching spots so I can salvage those areas too. It’s very easy to install and he hasn’t come close to ripping it down. If you have a picky cat, this is the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie H. Groeschell

customer_reviews.title: This product is pretty cool, but it is honesty a little bit ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is pretty cool, but it is honesty a little bit over priced and my cat has never shown any interest in it at all. He decided to stick with his traditional stretching post. Also, be aware that the adhesive used to keep this product hanging on the wall will literally rip the paint off of your wall, so I would suggest only using them on non-painted surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: John Ames

customer_reviews.title: I couldn’t be more pleased. You have a good product but I don’t ...
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and put it down on the floor and my cat walked on it and started to scratch. When she stopped she went to sleep on it. I couldn’t be more pleased .You have a good product but I don’t think I’ll hang it on the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 claws is paws down the best
customer_reviews.text: Well we put it on the wall but Stormy just walked by it. Underneath it was the once beautiful wood that has been terribly scratched. I was trying to entice her to use it but she just walked by. So, we took it off and just laid it on the carpet. She came over and went crazy on it. She LOVES it. So do we. I believe if we put it back on the wall she would now use it. One day soon we will get a 2nd one and try that. It is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: vedder

customer_reviews.title: They loved it, but I am not going to mount ...
customer_reviews.text: We laid it down so our two cats could use the backside before mounting it on the wall. The cats had the backside town up in three days. They loved it, but I am not going to mount it to the wall because it won't last long enough to warrant having the bracket-hooks stuck to the wall and we are not going to spend $30 on another one.
customer_reviews.author: William D. Darnall

customer_reviews.title: Great Scratching Post.
customer_reviews.text: Our kitty would not go near it at first. Not until I hit it with a laser pointer and she stuck her claws into it for the first time. She was hooked. Once she realized the feedback she was getting from the corrugated suface she became a believer. She is using it all the time. I wonder how long it will last. It is not cheap but it saves on the furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Gravman

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: A lifesaver! Both cats immediately loved it. It hooks firmly to the wall (and I was fearful it wouldn't.) I put it in the hallway between bedroom and living room so it is very accessible down a well-trodden path. It's a lifesaver because my cat of 12 years randomly started scratching furniture despite having scratching posts available. Anyway, both she and my other cat really like this tighly-woven cardboard scratcher. I have another 4CLAWS lounger and cat likes it, but prefers this wall-mounted hanging type.
customer_reviews.author: P. Catman

customer_reviews.title: I like it a lot. Kitty not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: good looking, unobtrusive, doesn't take up much space in the apartment, affordable, easy to mount to wall Cons: Kitty doesn't use it at all. But, she really doesn't seem interested in vertical scratching of anything else either, so this may be more about my cat than this scratching post. I bought her a horizontal flat scratcher also from 4CLAWS, and she likes that one.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith A. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Blends well and is sturdy enough to be clawed at by multiple assassin cats.
customer_reviews.text: My older cat destroyed this in a few weeks. It has never come off the wall no matter how hard she claws it. Time for some new ones to place all around the house!
customer_reviews.author: Els

customer_reviews.title: Cats and I both love it.
customer_reviews.text: Cats love it. I love that it hangs on the wall and so I don’t need to move anything to vacuum. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chase D.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend, my cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: It has been awhile since I've purchased this product and I am not disappointed. The post holds up well and my cat loves scratching it and rubbing up against it. Added perk is that my cat has focused on this product and not my couch!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: smaller than i thought it would be but I guess that’s my fault because i could’ve read the description better and cat products always photoshop the cat smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Riley

customer_reviews.title: Keep Those Kitties Happy
customer_reviews.text: My two kitties love this! I had the floor type but that seemed hard for them. With this they can stretch while they get those nails down. I used the hooks that came with it and it's still holding on the wall so that's great.
customer_reviews.author: J. Matthews

product_meta.title: 4CLAWS Wall Mounted Scratching Post 26" (White) - BASICS Collection Cat Scratcher, 26 x 5.7 x 5.5 in
product_meta.description:
Color:White

A Sturdy Vertical Scratcher 

The Scratching Post is wall mountable and sturdy enough for your cat to rest its weight on it while scratching and stretching. The hooks are mounted with adhesive pads which are easy to install on any clean vertical surface such as a cupboard or wall. The scratching post is 26" tall, allowing sufficient room for a comfortable vertical scratching position. 

Protect your walls, door frames or other vertical furniture and save money by offering your cats a better alternative to dig their claws in. The Scratching Post is designed to appeal to your kitty’s natural instinctive need for scratching and stretching. Get a couple and enjoy a discount! Your kitty will love it! 

Created with Premium Pressed Cardboard, the scratcher is dense and lasts longer than others. 

The scratching post measures 26" tall, 5.7" wide and 1.6" thick. 

 4CLAWS BASICS Collection 

Got extra scratching needs? Or have multiple cats to care for? Get the entire BASICS Collection scratchers that accommodate your cat’s every need to scratch. Designed and tested with different profiles, each model is tailored for a specific scratching posture. From horizontal, arched, inclined, to vertical scratching needs, our collection takes cares of every one of them.
feature_bullets: Tall vertical surface accommodates vertical scratching and stretching, wall mountable for extra sturdyness
Includes adhesive stainless steel mounting hooks for trouble free installation and replacement
Created with Premium Pressed Cardboard, the scratching post is dense and durable
Modern, minimal and space saving solution to your cats' scratching needs
100% Recyclable and made from Recycled Cardboard

specifications.Material: High Density Premium Pressed Corrugated Cardboard
specifications.Special Features: Environmentally Friendly, Biodegradable, Easy to Use
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars709 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
